turns.speaker: ALFONSO
turns.text: Zavitz, what? You want your old job back?

turns.speaker: ALFONSO
turns.text: Tired of chasing squirrels around the park?

turns.speaker: ALFONSO
turns.text: Lemme ask you something. I put a bird feeder out in the yard, but the squirrels, they keep taking--

turns.speaker: ALFONSO
turns.text: They keep taking the bird seed. I thought since you're the expert on--

turns.speaker: ZAVITZ
turns.text: Goddammit, shut the fuck up and turn on CNN!

turns.speaker: ALFONSO
turns.text: Alright, I made a joke about squirrels, don't get so--

turns.speaker: ZAVITZ
turns.text: No one. But I'm a little nervous.

turns.speaker: ALFONSO
turns.text: When can you get it here?

turns.speaker: ALFONSO
turns.text: Come straight here. Don't talk to anyone.

turns.speaker: BLAKE
turns.text: We've also been informed that the Grand Jury is going to call for an investigation into your affairs.

turns.speaker: BLAKE
turns.text: They want to hold you in Contempt for ethics violations.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Except for the part about my setting up a company in Zurich and knowing anyone named Sam Vollotti and having any relationship whatsoever with the Gambino family.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: What kind of a question is that?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I have a professional relationship with Rachel Banks. She's the go- between for a private investigator I use.

turns.speaker: BLAKE
turns.text: Why don't you just call Brill directly.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I don't know who he is.

turns.speaker: BLAKE
turns.text: I'm told you had an affair with Rachel Banks four years ago.

turns.speaker: BLAKE
turns.text: Considering the enormous exposure to which you've subjected this firm, I'd think you'd do best to simply answer my questions.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Well considering what a colossal douche bag you are, David, maybe I'd do best to simply kick your ass all over the capitol.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: You knew the deal. No contact.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: One of many people who would live a word with you.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: You've heard of the National Security Agency?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: What do they have to do with this?

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: You drive a black BMW, license plate SRK1339?

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: I clipped this from your wheel well just before they towed your car away.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I don't know what that means.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Like a LowJack, but two generations ahead of what the police use. It pulses at 230 Giga-Hertz.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I don't know what that means.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: 230 Giga-Hertz. They use that band for the Aquacade Spy-SAT uplinks.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I don't know what that means.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: It means the NSA can read the time off your wristwatch.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: If I knew, they'd be after <u>me</u>. Which they probably are right now. 'Bye.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Pal, you're cooked. It's over. What you did, who you were...that's done. I'd find a quiet job somewhere shoveling snow.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Why don't they just identify themselves and tell me what they want?

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Exposure. They can't have it. They wanna learn what you know and then deal with it.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: What am I gonna do?! I mean, like, for the rest of my <u>life</u>?!

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Hey, if you live another week I'll be impressed.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Look, you gave me some work over the last year. We'll call it even.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: What if I find out what they're after. You know these people, I don't.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: They froze your accounts. Get outa my way.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: How many years have <u>you</u> been hiding from them? How many years have you been running?  What'd they do to you?

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: If you find something, chalk the Baltimore Sheraton mailbox and go to Temperanceville. It's South of Salisbury.  And take this.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: You could knock on the door, you know, and I'd open it.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: I taped it off the 11 o'clock news.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: And you were worried about me. That's nice, I appreciate--

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: I was worried about my hundred and twenty 'K'.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: The price rises with the temperature and right now you're smokin'. But you're right, you should shop around and get the best price. I'll just let you out here.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: I mean did you call anyone.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: You don't get it. They go through your phone records. They fuckin' monitor everyone you called in the last--

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Oh, I'll bet <u>that</u> threw 'em off the scent. I sure hope you covered the mouthpiece with a handkerchief and used a funny voice!

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: The NSA's been in bed with the entire tele-communications industry since the 40's. They've infected everything: Banks, computers, phones, mail, name it.  The more technology we buy into, the easier it is keeping tabs on us. It's a brave new world.  At least it better be.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: How do you know so much?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: You used to work for 'em, didn't you?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: How'd you get around the tap orders?

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: They can tap anything as along as it's an airwave intercept. Cellulars and pagers your kid can do.  Hard-line calls we'd pick off the relays as they were being fed into ground cables or fired up to the SATs. We'd suck in everything. All foreign, most domestic.  Domestic was my group. Druggies, radicals, loud-mouths. Anyone we wanted.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: How'd you have the manpower to--

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Meade has 18 underground acres of computers. They scan <u>every</u> phonecall for target words like "bomb" or "President". We red-flag phone numbers or voice prints...whatever we wanted. When the computers found something, it was bounced to comparative analysis.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: That was twenty years ago. With digital? They can suck a salt grain off a beach.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: It was '72. I figured we had enough problems without monitoring a Berkeley kid's class schedule. So I sold my story to <u>Ramparts</u> and split.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Well...there'd be too much disclosure to prosecute me. So they ruined my records and made sure I'd never hold a real job again.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: It really is.  Did you find anything?

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Yeah.  Take a walk with me.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Remember when Senator Hamersley died in an accident up near Shenandoah?

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Well, actually, <u>you</u> have proof. Could you walk a little faster please.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: In the warehouse. They're hiding in a duct on the third floor. When we go back inside, they're gonna kill us. When they notice that we're moving toward the car, they'll come running out of the building.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: 'Kay, well, could you walk faster, please.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Empty 'em 'till they're almost flat. And turn your head. There might be some debris flying your way.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: They shouldn't have come without calling first.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I didn't see a warrant. Did you see a warrant?

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Think we let out enough air?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Let's not do the tire thing anymore, okay?

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Yeah, I can see where that'd--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Tell him we're not gonna hurt him.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Drive or I'll blow your fuckin' head off.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: We're honest people and we need your help. I'll give you two- hundred dollars if you--

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Listen to you, "directly". You're not gonna get <u>near</u> the News Department. And if you did, it'd never get on the air. Time-Life buried the Zapruder film for 15 years.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: So what do we do now?

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: I was thinkin' about asking for my hundred and fifty grand and calling it quits.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: What if we do a mailing to Congressmen.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: It'd never get through. All packages are screened, x-rayed and then hand-searched for explosives. You didn't like my "give-me-my- money" idea?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: What if we hand deliver to their homes or office?

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: The area's wired for surveillance, they'll be <u>looking</u> for those moves.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Well how do <u>I</u> know what they're--

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: <u>I</u> know. <u>I</u> know what they're looking for and I'm telling you.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: What if we transmitted it over cellular?

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Nah, they'd shut down the pin number.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: If they couldn't do that, they'd shut down the whole system, all the relays.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: They've done it before. Takes maybe two minutes.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: What if we just fucked with 'em?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Same way they did with you and me. We take their biggest guy and turn him into one of us.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: You wanna get caught spying on Albert?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: No, I want the NSA to get caught spying on Albert.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: We're gonna lead Albert by the nose to one conclusion. And then when he's pissed as hell, we're gonna drop the tape in his lap. How fast can you teach me what I need to know?

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: We'll have to re-stock some basics.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: What do you know about locking cellular phone signals?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I know my phone number and I know the number for SportsPhone. Beyond that--

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: AmeriTech's data-base.  There's Albert's D.C. office address and his phone's identity code. Now we just reprogram out phone with his ID code and you know what we've got?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: He came in four minutes ago.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: It's Pat Cary. I work for Senator Sam Albert and I was given Jerry's name.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Jerry's on vacation 'till Monday. I can give him the message when he gets back. That was Patrick and the last name--

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: The thing is...it really can't wait.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: My name's Neil. Maybe I can help you.

turns.speaker: SENATOR ALBERT
turns.text: --Don't think it could've gone any better. Tell me, how's Deb? How're my grandchildren?

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: A receiver tuned permanently to the Senator's phone.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Well, sir, I'm afraid it's not as simple as that. Your average newspaper guy or Hard Copy lady or whatever, they can't buy this stuff.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Ah, sir, you know, it's not for me to say.

turns.speaker: SENATOR ALBERT
turns.text: What do you mean? Who can buy this kind of equipment.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: The thing is, Senator, and I don't want to get in the middle of nothing, but--

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Most of this stuff's only available to law enforcement.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: I yanked this off your RV. It's a Global Positioning Tracker.

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: Tracks your location to the inch and works directly with--you know...

turns.speaker: BRILL
turns.text: With spy satellites. I don't like saying these things Senator...

turns.speaker: SENATOR ALBERT
turns.text: Neil, thank you for your help.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Dylan, I was just asking Eric if--

turns.speaker: DYLAN
turns.text: Oh, God, I <u>knew</u> it was stupid, I <u>knew</u> we'd get caught. But the Gameboy was just <u>sitting</u> there. Right on top of the bag. Yes. Yes. We took the GameBoy out of the bag, but with every intention of putting it back.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: You're a tough nut to crack, Dylan.

turns.speaker: SALES CLERK
turns.text: Do you see anything you like?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I'm married to my wife...of several years...and I'd like to buy...as a Christmas present...

turns.speaker: SALES CLERK
turns.text: You'd like to buy your wife some lingerie as a Christmas gift.

turns.speaker: SALES CLERK
turns.text: It's okay. I think it's a wonderful gift.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I don't know anything about this. Well, I mean, I know a <u>little</u> about--from a certain perspective. My point is, I don't want to do anything foolish.

turns.speaker: SALES CLERK
turns.text: It's a little late for that.

turns.speaker: SALES CLERK
turns.text: I think she'll like this very much.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Listen, Daniel, hang on one second.

turns.speaker: SALES CLERK
turns.text: For that matter, I think you will too.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Could you give me just a moment to talk to a friend of mine here? Not about this, but...Daniel?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: <u>Wildlife</u> footage, for God's sake. I don't see how he could've slipped you something that the FBI would be interested in.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Well, I need to find out as much about Daniel as possible.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Because my life is being ruined.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Daniel's life is already ruined. Maybe if you guys stopped thinking about yourselves for a change and--

turns.speaker: MORELOS
turns.text: I didn't want to bother you during your racquetball game.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Hey, did you guys find my stuff?

turns.speaker: MORELOS
turns.text: No, sir, I'm not involved with that. I'm doing a quick follow-up on a bus accident took place a few nights ago. Your name keeps coming up.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Oh...yeah, I didn't see the accident.

turns.speaker: MORELOS
turns.text: Witnesses said you were there, but I notice you didn't file a report.

turns.speaker: MORELOS
turns.text: You weren't at Harrison's Department Store the night before--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I was <u>in</u> the store, the accident was outside. It was a bus.

turns.speaker: MORELOS
turns.text: Someone said you spoke to Mr. Zavitz before he died. I thought you might know something.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I'm no expert, but I'm assuming that the impact of a moving bus against his body caused--

turns.speaker: MORELOS
turns.text: Than why can't you tell me.

turns.speaker: MORELOS
turns.text: I'm just trying to determine if Mr. Zavitz was involved in something more than a simple bus accident.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Than why don't you talk to the bus driver?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I'm happy to help you all I can. But I didn't see the accident and I barely knew Daniel Zavitz. I've gotta go to work.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: <u>Yes</u>, for my wife, what the hell kinds of questions are these.

turns.speaker: MORELOS
turns.text: I thought maybe it might be for Rachel Banks.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I don't know what's goin' on with Zavitz, but that was way, <u>way</u> outa line.  You understand?

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: This guy's a fat-assed Rotarian gasbag.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Not a very good one, but--

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: So you tap everyone's phone? You use computers to probe financial records? New Search and Seizure laws?

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: We won't suspend the civil rights of the good people.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I think you're taking it seriously enough for both of us.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: You're a lawyer. Don't you care what's going on around you?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: In front of Harrison's, he got hit by a bus. I knew him. The firm did some pro bono work for his organization a few years back.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: The thing is, when I saw him, it seemed like he wanted to tell me...  ...he was upset about something and he said...  Doesn't matter now.  I'm gonna wash up.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: A toaster. And no terrorist talk at dinner. You're spookin' the kids.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: How'd you get the information on DePinto?

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: Who did you work with to get the--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: A guy named Brill. Same guy as always.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: Yeah, but you said you've never met him. How did you--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Honey, I don't like to talk about this stuff in front of Eric.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: Have you been working with Rachel?

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: I don't understand why Jerry couldn't clear this up.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: There's just, clearly, some administrative snafu. I'm sure this is the worst of it.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: How could you let me find out like this?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Stacy, I found out like this. This is the first I'm <u>hearing</u> of--

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: "Sources revealed an FBI investigation into a possible money laundering scheme that may have sent millions of dollars--

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: "At the center of the investigation are well-known Washington-area attorneys Robert Dean and Rachel Banks."

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I have lunch with Rachel once a month. She's my connection to an investigator.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: I told you I didn't want you seeing her.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: You had an affair with this woman, Robert, we went to a fucking <u>counselor</u> for a year.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: You told me you weren't seeing her at <u>all</u>.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I didn't want you to be upset. I shouldn't have lied. Stacy, there's nothing between me and Rachel Banks.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: The date stamp on the picture is last <u>month</u>. Is that where you and Rachel conduct business.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: It's not real...  That's not me.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: It's not a real picture, Stacy, it's been doctored-up.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: I think you should leave now, Robert.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: Do you know what I'm looking at Robert?

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: I'm looking at a picture of you and Rachel taken <u>yesterday</u>.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: No, I was with her yesterday. I want you to take Eric and go to our parents house. I want you to do it right now.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: I went to the grocery store. My ATM and credit cards didn't work. I couldn't buy food.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: I went to the bank to see why. They said you emptied our accounts--

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: This is science-fiction Robert! The manager showed me the transfer notice with your signature on it.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Stacy, somebody's trying to kill me. Now goddamit--

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: My father's put me in touch with an attorney. He'll be--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Has anyone been by? Police? FBI?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I wish you'd gone to your parents like I asked you.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: This is my house. Nobody's kicking me out of my house. I picked those drapes.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I don't think anybody wants the drapes, Stacy, I think the drapes are okay.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I was in a car chase and a small explosion. Now listen to me: The NSA is behind this. They think that guy I told you about, Daniel Zavitz, they think Zavitz gave me a tape or computer chip of some kind that could be damaging to them. So they're doing all these things <u>electronically</u>. The bank records, the surveillance. They're the ones who broke into the house. Now I know there's no reason to believe me. But I love you. And I love our son. So just believe me anyway.  Please.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: I <u>told</u> you they could do this. I <u>told</u> you they had this kind of capability and that with this anti- terrorism it would be just another--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Stacy...Stacy...maybe now isn't the best time for the I-Told-You-So speech.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: I'm sorry I didn't believe you.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: I opened the present you got me from Harrison's.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: You're as bad as Eric. I've got an entire family of people who root through--

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: They're saying you killed that policeman.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Albert's gonna get me my job back.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Yeah.  I wish you could've met...

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: A friend of mine. I don't know his real name. He's dead now.

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: I'm sorry, sir, this card's been declined.

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: I'm sure we can locate it for you, sir.

turns.speaker: DEPINTO
turns.text: What can I do for you?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Well, I was hoping you might stop by my office to swear out a criminal deposition against some of your friends and co-workers.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I don't believe it is, no.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I've got photographs of you at the Trenton Ramada looking very--

turns.speaker: DEPINTO
turns.text: You don't know who the fuck--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: That's not you having a whiskey sour with Carmine Morada.

turns.speaker: DEPINTO
turns.text: This is fucked. You don't know <u>who's</u> in that--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: You're right, Mr. DePinto, and maybe I jumped the gun.

turns.speaker: DEPINTO
turns.text: You're goddam right you jumped the gun.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: That's probably not you in the picture. I tell you what, I'll just run the thing by the Grand Jury, see if they can't--

turns.speaker: DEPINTO
turns.text: I want to talk to a goddam lawyer.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Good news there, Mr. DePinto, you're talking to one.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: I'm sorry. I'm not sure I understand. You wanna fuckin' <u>what</u>?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I'd like to speak to someone about what's happening to me.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: My wife's Jewish. But that probably doesn't matter right now.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I'll see if I can, you know, work things out.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I mean it tastes like every other fish I've ever had. Every fish tastes the same.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Here's what you asked for. Brill's note said it was everything you'd need to, shall we say, coax DePinto--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: When do I get to meet him?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: That wasn't the answer I was hoping for.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: "Soon". Or at least sooner than never.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Ten thousand cash. I don't know if it's Brill's prices going up or your commission.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I take a straight 15 percent. Brill's fee varies with risk. Perhaps you'd be more comfortable using someone else.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Someone with whom you don't have quite so personal a--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I <u>like</u> our history. And I like you. I'd probably like <u>Brill</u> if I ever got to--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I just want to make sure I'm not breaking the law.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I wouldn't let you. Good luck with DePinto.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Mr. DePinto? My name's Robert Dean. I'm an attorney with Seth, Silverberg.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I got a call from my firm this morning saying don't come in.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: There are reporters wanting to know about my relationship with you and how long I've worked for the mob. The <u>mob</u>, Bobby!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Good. You're just what I need right now.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: It's really not a good idea for me to be seen with you.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Will you hang on just a second.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: The IRS contacted me this morning. They say my lifestyle and receipts exceed my income.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: My firm'll represent you. Free of charge.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You don't work there anymore, Bobby.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Fuck you. When you needed information, I got it. You didn't care how.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: What're you gonna do, Rachel? You gonna sit in a bar in Baltimore? You want your job back? You want a life?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I don't <u>have</u> a life, Bobby. I'm in love with a married man.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: What makes you think it's you?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You're a moron, you know that?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Any idea what he looks like?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: My guess is male, somewhere in his 40's or 50's.

turns.speaker: PRATT
turns.text: We'd like to ask you some questions about Daniel Zavitz.

turns.speaker: PRATT
turns.text: I'm an investigator with Pro-Tech Security.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I went through this with an investigator this morning. If I could--

turns.speaker: PRATT
turns.text: Mr. Zavitz was involved in an extortion scheme. We believe he passed you sensitive materials, possibly with your knowledge, and we need to--

turns.speaker: PRATT
turns.text: We have good reason to believe that he passed you--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: If he passed me materials, I'd have them. I don't.

turns.speaker: PRATT
turns.text: We'd like to recover any materials Mr. Zavitz may have given you--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Otherwise you may have to what?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Fuck you. You may have to what?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Otherwise you may have to what?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Fuck you. You may have to--

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Forget me, forget what I did for you. Don't <u>ever</u> mention my name or try to contact me again. Get it?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I don't <u>know</u> you, I don't <u>know</u> your name, I don't know <u>what</u> the hell you did for me except hang up on my wife and slam me into a wall, but I'm getting pretty fuckin' <u>sick</u> of this! Get it?!

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: God knows I would, sir, but I have a previous engagement this evening.

turns.speaker: SILVERBERG
turns.text: And may I ask what could possibly be more important than Fawell Oil v. U.S. Environmental Agency?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I have to go lingerie shopping.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Diane, maybe you didn't hear Mr. Silverberg. They've got models that'll try on the garments.  Thank you, sir.

turns.speaker: SILVERBERG
turns.text: I got a call this morning from a source I trust. The Post is running a lead this afternoon about your involvement in the Bellmoth investigation.

turns.speaker: SILVERBERG
turns.text: They claim you helped create a shell company for Sam Vollotti in Zurich and that through your continuing relationship, the Gambino family's been able to exert influence and provide false witnesses to discredit our case.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Gimme a week and four guys from litigation and I'll have the Post pleading with us not to sue for libel.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: This is <u>bullshit</u>. Someone's mixing up a bunch of half-truths to ruin me and to ruin my case.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Maybe Bellmoth. Maybe the unions. I don't know.

turns.speaker: SILVERBERG
turns.text: Well until we find, you're gonna have to take a leave of absence.

turns.speaker: SILVERBERG
turns.text: A leave of absence. Until we've sorted this all out.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Put David on it. He seems anxious to clear my name.
